Settings.Name: EnableLoadIndexForObjectBinds
Settings.Description: Toggles whether or not LOAD_INDEX packets are used for binding objects to the command buffer in place of set packets.

Settings.Name: DisableBorderColorPaletteBinds
Settings.Description: Disables binding of border color palettes, and forces any samplers created to use a transparent black color.

Settings.Name: DrainPsOnOverlap
Settings.Description: Related to primitive ordered pixel shading.  If set, forces the PS to drain on anydetected overlapping wave

Values.Name: Gfx9PrintMetaEquationInfoProcessing
Values.Description: Prints equation coordinates as they're processed.

Settings.Name: PrintMetaEquationInfo
Settings.Description: Controls printing of meta-equation data.  Debug builds only.

Settings.Name: ProcessMetaEquationViaCpu
Settings.Description: If true, the meta-equations will be processed by the cpu instead of by a compute shader.Emulation, debug builds only.  Useful for pre-silicon development

Values.Name: Gfx9OptimizedFastClearDisabled
Values.Description: Disable the Optimized Fast Clear Path.

Values.Name: Gfx9OptimizedFastClearColorCmask
Values.Description: Enable Optimized Fast Clear Path for color surfaces cmask metadata fastclear(msaa only).

Values.Name: Gfx9OptimizedFastClearColorDcc
Values.Description: Enable Optimized Fast Clear Path for color surfaces dcc metadata fastclear.

Values.Name: Gfx9OptimizedFastClearDepth
Values.Description: Enable Optimized Fast Clear Path for depth surfaces htile metadata fastclear.

Settings.Name: OptimizedFastClear
Settings.Description: If enabled, the meta-equations will be processed by an optimized compute shader and algorithm.

Settings.Name: AlwaysDecompress
Settings.Description: Controls whether the specified decompress / expand / eliminate operations will always occur when requested.

Settings.Name: Treat1dAs2d
Settings.Description: True to override 1D images to be 2D instead.

Settings.Name: ForceRegularClearCode
Settings.Description: Forces a fast clear code to be the regular clear code and turns off AC01 compression which makes sure the four 'magic' compressed clear codes aren't used.

Settings.Name: ForceGraphicsFillMemoryPath
Settings.Description: Forces use of a graphics fill memory path on command buffers that supports graphics ops

Settings.Name: WaitOnMetadataMipTail
Settings.Description: Controls whether to wait after F/I when changing targets within a Metadata mip tail region. This can resolve corruptions related to metadata cache conflicts.

Settings.Name: BlendOptimizationEnable
Settings.Description: If true, writes the COLOR_SRC_OPT and COLOR_DST_OPT bits of theSX_MRT#_BLEND_OPT for Blend States.

Settings.Name: FastColorClearEnable
Settings.Description: If true, DCC will be used to support fast color clears on singlesampled Color Target Images.

Settings.Name: FastColorClearOn3DEnable
Settings.Description: If true, DCC will be used to support fast color clears on singlesampled 3D Color Target Images.

Settings.Name: FmaskCompressDisable
Settings.Description: Controls the setting of the CB_COLOR_INFO.FMASK_COMPRESSION_DISABLE bit.

Settings.Name: FmaskAllowPipeBankXor
Settings.Description: If true, allows for non-zero fMask pipe-bank-xor.

Settings.Name: DccOnComputeEnable
Settings.Description: Determines the situations on which a compute shader will be used for DCC access.

Values.Name: Gfx9UseDccForNonReadableFormats
Values.Description: Non-readable but still renderable or shader-writeable formats

Settings.Name: UseDcc
Settings.Description: Bitmask of cases where DCC (delta color compression) surfaces will be used

Values.Description: Do not limit number of waves in flight in each compute unit.
Limits the number of waves in flight in each compute unit.

Settings.Name: CsMaxWavesPerCu
Settings.Description: Controls the WAVES_PER_SH field in the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_LIMITS register; note that it is specified per-CU rather than per-SH for convenience.

Values.Description: CS per-SH low threshold for locking.

Settings.Name: CsLockThreshold
Settings.Description: Controls the LOCK_THRESHOLD field in the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_LIMITS register. CS per-SH low threshold for locking.

Settings.Name: CsSimdDestCntl
Settings.Description: Controls the SIMD_DEST_CNTL field of the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_LIMITS register. By default, this flag is calulated based on the number of waves in the dispatch. If the number of waves is a multiple of 4, this flag is set, otherwise it is cleared.

Settings.Name: HtileEnable
Settings.Description: If true, HTile will be enabled for depth/stencil images.

Settings.Name: DepthCompressEnable
Settings.Description: If true, depth compression will be enabled.

Settings.Name: StencilCompressEnable
Settings.Description: If true, stencil compression will be enabled.

Settings.Name: DbPreloadEnable
Settings.Description: If true, DB preloading will be enabled.

Settings.Name: DbPreloadWinEnable
Settings.Description: If true, DB preload window dimensions will be used instead of the depth buffer's dimensions.

Settings.Name: DbPerTileExpClearEnable
Settings.Description: If true, per-tile tracking of exp/clear will be enabled.

Settings.Name: HiDepthEnable
Settings.Description: If true, hierarchical depth testing will be enabled.

Settings.Name: HiStencilEnable
Settings.Description: If true, hierarchical stencil testing will be enabled.

Settings.Name: DbRequestSize
Settings.Description: Specifies the DB read request size.

Settings.Name: DbDisableColorOnValidation
Settings.Description: Controls the DB_RENDER_OVERRIDE2.DISABLE_COLOR_ON_VALIDATION register field

Settings.Name: EnableOnchipGs
Settings.Description: If true, onchip GS will be used if possible.

Values.Name: OutOfOrderPrimSafe
Values.Description: Enable when known to not affect render output.

Values.Name: OutOfOrderPrimAggressive
Values.Description: Enable when suspected to not affect render output.

Settings.Name: EnableOutOfOrderPrimitives
Settings.Description: Enable out-of-order primitive mode. Only available on parts that have more than one VGT.

Values.Description: Values are log(2) of the watermark.

Settings.Name: OutOfOrderWatermark
Settings.Description: The watermark value for out-of-order primitives.

Settings.Name: GsCuGroupEnabled
Settings.Description: If true, the HW-GS stage will prefer to send a wave to each SIMD in a CU before moving to the next enabled CU. If false, HW-GS prefers to send only one wave to each CU before moving to the next enabled CU.

Settings.Name: GsMaxLdsSize
Settings.Description: Maximum amount of LDS space to alloc for each on-chip GS subgroup, in DWORDs.

Settings.Name: GsOffChipThreshold
Settings.Description: If the number of GS prims per subgroup * GS instance count is less than this threshold use off-chip GS.

Settings.Name: GsPrimsPerSubGroup
Settings.Description: Target number of GS prims per subgroup when running with on-chip GS.

Settings.Name: LateAllocGs
Settings.Description: Controls the value for late-alloc GS.

Values.Name: LateAllocVsBehaviorLegacy
Values.Description: Enable late-alloc vs, but incorrectly masks off CUs in dynamic mode

Values.Name: LateAllocVsBehaviorDynamicEnableAllCus
Values.Description: Enable late-alloc vs, but don't mask off CUs

Settings.Name: LateAllocVs
Settings.Description: Controls the behavior for late-alloc VS.

Settings.Name: MaxTessFactor
Settings.Description: Clamps the maximum tessellation factor.

Settings.Name: NumOffchipLdsBuffers
Settings.Description: Controls the number of LDS buffers used for offchip tessellation: Gfx9: 1->508: Number of offchip tessellation buffers.

Settings.Name: NumTessPatchesPerThreadGroup
Settings.Description: Controls the number of patches-per-thread-group to run when tessellationis enabled. This value is normally limited by hardware resources (LDS,TFBuffer, Threads). - Setting to 1 will always work, but is slowest. - Setting to 0 will allow the driver to choose the optimal value. - Any other value will be used (clamped based on HW resources). Offchip Tess rounds this to the nearest multiple of four.

Settings.Name: OffchipLdsBufferSize
Settings.Description: Controls the size of each offchip LDS Buffer.

Settings.Name: IsolineDistributionFactor
Settings.Description: Used by the hardware when distributed tessellation is active: the min tess factors for each patch processed by a VGT are accumulated. When the sum exceeds this threshold, the next patch is sent to a different VGT.

Settings.Name: TriDistributionFactor
Settings.Description: Used by the hardware when distributed tessellation is active: the min tess factors for each patch processed by a VGT are accumulated. When the sum exceeds this threshold, the next patch is sent to a different VGT. Recommended to be higher than quad factor

Settings.Name: QuadDistributionFactor
Settings.Description: Used by the hardware when distributed tessellation is active: the min tess factors for each patch processed by a VGT are accumulated. When the sum exceeds this threshold, the next patch is sent to a different VGT.

Settings.Name: DonutDistributionFactor
Settings.Description: Used by the hardware when distributed tessellation is in DONUT mode: the min tess factor for each patch is tested against this threshold to determine whether a patch gets split up. If the patch isn't split, it still increments the accumulator for the Patch distribution factor.

Settings.Name: TrapezoidDistributionFactor
Settings.Description: Used when the distribution mode is TRAPEZOID for quad and tri domain types. The number of donuts in the patch are compared against this value to detemine whether this donut gets split up into trapezoids (needs the patch to be in donut mode). A value of 0 or 1 will be treated as 2. The innermost donut is never allowed to be broken into trapezoids.

Settings.Name: PrimgroupSize
Settings.Description: Number of primitives sent to one VGT before switching to the next. Valid range is 1-65536, values larger than 256 are expected to hurtperformance. This setting only affects non-tessellation and non-NGG pipelines.

Settings.Name: PsCuGroupEnabled
Settings.Description: If true, the HW-PS stage will prefer to send a wave to each SIMD in a CU before moving to the next enabled CU. If false, HW-PS prefers to send only one wave to each CU before moving to the next enabled CU.

Settings.Name: RbPlusEnable
Settings.Description: If true, RbPlus will be enabled for ASIC of RbPlus capability.

Settings.Name: SwitchVgtOnDraw
Settings.Description: If true, the HW will alternate VGT's between draws rather than between sets of primitives within a draw. True is safer, but less performant.

Settings.Name: TessFactorBufferSizePerSe
Settings.Description: Controls the size of the tess-factor buffer. This size is per-SE, andmeasured in DWORDs.

Settings.Name: TessWalkPattern
Settings.Description: Vertex walking pattern for tessellation: 0: (default) Donut walking pattern for optimal reuse. 1: Single-ring walking pattern, has suboptimal reuse.

Settings.Name: UseMaxOffchipLdsBuffers
Settings.Description: If true, offchip tessellation will always use the maximum number ofLDS buffers possible (based on Chip ID).

Settings.Name: VsCuGroupEnabled
Settings.Description: If true, the HW-VS stage will prefer to send a wave to each SIMD in a CU before moving to the next enabled CU. If false, HW-VS prefers to send only one wave to each CU before moving to the next enabled CU.

Settings.Name: VsHalfPackThreshold
Settings.Description: Load half-packed VS waves, forcing them to use half as much space in the param cache at the expense of inefficient use of ALU resources, if the export count is >= this threshold. This can help performance in some cases.

Settings.Name: VsForcePartialWave
Settings.Description: If true, forces the VGT to issue a VS wave as soon as a primgroup isfinished.

Settings.Name: DisableCoverageAaMask
Settings.Description: Current recommendation from the hardware team is to force PA_SC_CONSERVATIVE_RAST_CNTL.COVERAGE_AA_MASK = 0

Values.Name: Gfx9WdLoadBalancingAdvanced
Values.Description: Advanced. Enabled basic mode plus small instance unrolling draws optimization.

Settings.Name: WdLoadBalancingMode
Settings.Description: Setting for controlling work distributor load balancing.

Settings.Name: BatchBreakOnNewPixelShader
Settings.Description: True forces a BATCH_BREAK event when a new pixel shader is bound. False by default.

Settings.Name: GsCuEnLimitMask
Settings.Description: This mask is AND-ed with the driver-decided GS-specific CU_EN mask to further allow limiting of enabled CUs for GS waves.

Settings.Name: VsCuEnLimitMask
Settings.Description: This mask is AND-ed with the driver-decided VS-specific CU_EN mask to further allow limiting of enabled CUs for VS waves.

Settings.Name: PsCuEnLimitMask
Settings.Description: This mask is AND-ed with the driver-decided PS-specific CU_EN mask to further allow limiting of enabled CUs for PS waves.

Settings.Name: CsCuEnLimitMask
Settings.Description: This mask is AND-ed with the driver-decided CS-specific CU_EN mask to further allow limiting of enabled CUs for CS waves.

Values.Name: Gfx9OffChipHsImmediate
Values.Description: Copy HS outputs directly to off-chip memory.

Values.Name: Gfx9OffChipHsCopyAllAtEnd
Values.Description: Write HS outputs to LDS, then at end of HS use multi-threaded loop to copy from LDS to off-chip memory.

Values.Name: Gfx9OffChipHsCopyMultiElements
Values.Description: Writes output control points and patch constants directly to off-chip and only copy theinput control point to memory at the end.

Settings.Name: OffChipHsCopyMethod
Settings.Description: Specifies to SC how to copy HS outputs to off-chip memory.

Settings.Name: OffChipHsSkipDataCopyNullPatch
Settings.Description: Enables SC optimization to skip copying data from HS for null patches

Settings.Name: OptimizeDsDataFetch
Settings.Description: Enables SC optimization for optimized DS data fetch.

Settings.Name: NggEnableMode
Settings.Description: Setting for the enablement of NGG on a per-pipeline type basis. For quality purposes only.

Settings.Name: NggSubgroupSize
Settings.Description: Controls the default NGG subgroup size handling. Only useful if client calls Pal::IDevice::ScpcGraphicsPipelineTuningOptions().

Settings.Name: NggPrimsPerSubgroup
Settings.Description: Controls the value for primitives per subgroup for NGG pipelines. Only used if NggSubgroupSize is set to Explicit.

Settings.Name: NggVertsPerSubgroup
Settings.Description: Controls the value for vertices per subgroup for NGG pipelines. Only used if NggSubgroupSize is set to Explicit.

Settings.Name: NggLateAllocGs
Settings.Description: Controls the value for late-alloc GS for NGG pipelines. Can be no more than 127.

Settings.Name: EnableBackfaceCullMask
Settings.Description: Setting for the enablement of backface culling on a per-pipeline type basis. For quality purposes only.

Settings.Name: EnableAccurateFrustumCullMask
Settings.Description: Setting for the enablement of accurate frustum culling on a per-pipeline type basis. For quality purposes only.

Settings.Name: EnableSmallPrimFilterMask
Settings.Description: Setting for the enablement of small primitive filter culling on a per-pipeline type basis. For quality purposes only.

Settings.Name: NggEnableFasterLaunchRate
Settings.Description: If true, enables faster launch rate for all NGG pipelines. For quality testing purposes only.

Settings.Name: EnableOrderedIdMode
Settings.Description: If true, enables VGT_SHADER_STAGES_EN::ORDERED_ID_MODE. Only applies to NGG piplines.

Settings.Name: NggRingSize
Settings.Description: Controls how many instances of the NGG shader-data tables will be contained in the ring buffer managed by Universal Command Buffers. At most, the constant engine will be able to get that many draws ahead of the draw engine. This must be either zero, or divisible by four. If zero, any pipeline which requires NGG will fail to compile because no SRD table is present.

Settings.Name: DeferredBatchBinMode
Settings.Description: Controls whether or not deferred batch binning is enabled 0 : Batch binning always disabled 1 : Use custom bin sizes 2 : Optimal

Settings.Name: CustomBatchBinSize
Settings.Description: Controls the custom batch bin size.  Only used when deferredBatchBinMode==1 High word is for x, low word is for y.  Default is 128x128.  Values must be power-of-two between 16 and 512

Settings.Name: DisableBinningPsKill
Settings.Description: If true, binning is disabled when the PS has a discard instruction or can be trivially rejected.

Settings.Name: DisableBinningNoDb
Settings.Description: If true, binning is disabled if there is no depth buffer bound.

Settings.Name: DisableBinningBlendingOff
Settings.Description: If true, binning is disabled if blending is disabled or blending does not require the destination color to be read.

Settings.Name: BinningMaxAllocCountLegacy
Settings.Description: Maximum amount of parameter storage per batch when not using NGG. Units are parameter cache lines divided by two. The maximum is value 128. Zero means calculate an optimal value based on the hardware configuration.

Settings.Name: BinningMaxAllocCountNggOnChip
Settings.Description: Maximum amount of parameter storage per batch when using NGG with the on-chip parameter cache. Units are parameter cache lines divided by two. Zero means calculate an optimal value based on the hardware configuration.

Settings.Name: BinningMaxPrimPerBatch
Settings.Description: Maximum number of primitives per batch. The maximum value is 1024.

Settings.Name: BinningContextStatesPerBin
Settings.Description: Maximum number of context rolls before breaking a batch. The maximum value is 6.

Settings.Name: BinningPersistentStatesPerBin
Settings.Description: Maximum number of persistent states per batch. The maximum value is 31.

Settings.Name: BinningFpovsPerBatch
Settings.Description: Maximum number of FPOV tokens allowed per batch. Zero means no limit.

Settings.Name: BinningOptimalBinSelection
Settings.Description: Value for the PA_SC_BINNER_CNTL_1::OPTIMAL_BIN_SELECTION register field.

Settings.Name: BinningDisableBinningAppendConsume
Settings.Description: If true, disable Binning when the PS uses UAV append or consume

Settings.Name: DisableDfsm
Settings.Description: If true, DFSM is disabled.

Settings.Name: DisableDfsmPsUav
Settings.Description: If true, DFSM is disabled when the pixel shader uses UAVs or ROVs.

Settings.Name: ShaderPrefetchMethod
Settings.Description: Select method of shader prefetching:  0: CP DMA (primes UTCL2 and TCC) 1: PRIME_UTCL2 (primes the UTCL2)

Settings.Name: PrefetchCommandBuffers
Settings.Description: Controls whether CP command buffers are prefetched into the Gfx L2.

Settings.Name: AnisoFilterOptEnabled
Settings.Description: Controls whether anisotropic filtering optimizations are enabled.

Settings.Name: CeilingLogicEnabled
Settings.Description: Controls whether the round-up logic for samplers is enabled.

Settings.Name: PrecisionFixEnabled
Settings.Description: Controls whether rounding of values coming out of the normalizer is enabled.

Settings.Name: SamplerPerfMip
Settings.Description: Controls the value of the PERF_MIP field in Sampler SRD's.

Settings.Name: SamplerAnisoThreshold
Settings.Description: Controls the value of the anisotropy threshold for Sampler SRD's.

Settings.Name: SamplerAnisoBias
Settings.Description: Controls the value of the anisotropy bias for Sampler SRD's.

Settings.Name: SamplerSecAnisoBias
Settings.Description: Controls the value of the secondary anisotropy bias for Sampler SRD's.

Settings.Name: WaRestrictMetaDataUseInMipTail
Settings.Description: If the workaround is enabled, then only those mips up to and including the first mip in the mip tail will be compressed.

Settings.Name: WaWrite1xAASampleLocationsToZero
Settings.Description: Controls whether the workaround waWrite1xAASampleLocationsToZero is active. FALSE:   Forces the workaround off. TRUE:    Forces the workaround on. Not Set: Allows the driver to decide, based on Chip ID.

Settings.Name: WaColorCacheControllerInvalidEviction
Settings.Description: The overwrite combiner marks something as overwritten even if there are ensuingquads to the same sector that need dest

Settings.Name: WaOverwriteCombinerTargetMaskOnly
Settings.Description: The overwrite combiner takes only the target mask into consideration while decidingto overwrite combine whereas the other parts of the CB decide on shader mask andtarget mask. This discrepancy may lead to the overwrite combiner incorrectly signalinga read optimization when shader and target mask are different

Settings.Name: WaDisableHtilePrefetch
Settings.Description: Controls if hTile prefetch is disbled.

Settings.Name: WaMiscPopsMissedOverlap
Settings.Description: Controls if STALLED_POPS is used or not.

Settings.Name: WaMiscScissorRegisterChange
Settings.Description: Controls if whenever a context roll is detected whether the scissor registers will be rewritten.

Settings.Name: WaMiscPsFlushScissorChange
Settings.Description: Controls if a PS_PARTIAL_FLUSH is used whenever the scissor top-left or bottom-right registers change.

Settings.Name: WaHtilePipeBankXorMustBeZero
Settings.Description: If set, hTile buffers support non-zero pipe-bank xor values.

Settings.Name: WaDisableDfsmWithEqaa
Settings.Description: If set, DFSM will be disabled when EQAA surfaces are bound to the DB

Settings.Name: WaDisable24BitHWFormatForTCCompatibleDepth
Settings.Description: If set PAL will not set 24_8 hw format for 24-32bit converted depth surfaces, this will fix fast clear expansion with TC compatible surfaces (but also return incorrect unclamped border color.)

Settings.Name: WaDummyZpassDoneBeforeTs
Settings.Description: On Gfx9, the DB can delay tile write requests in such a way that its pending write ack counters can underflow while processing EOP timestamps. The workaround is to issue a ZPASS_DONE event before each timestamp event because it will add pending writes which are lower priority than the tile writes so they will fence the delayed writes. Defaults to TRUE for Gfx9, FALSE for others.

Settings.Name: WaMetaAliasingFixEnabled
Settings.Description: On Gfx9, the meta-addressing equation can theoretically map multiple pixels to the same This fix prevents that from happening.  Meta-equation generated by driver must match the meta equation as generated by the silicon.  Products that do not have the fix have no HW configurations that expose the problem.

Settings.Name: WaForce256bCbFetch
Settings.Description: If set PAL sets CB_COLOR_ATTRIB.LIMIT_COLOR_FETCH_TO_256B_MAX = 1 for mip levels in the tail that aren't the largest.

Settings.Name: WaCmaskImageSyncs
Settings.Description: If set, align image allocation size up to fragment size when Cmask is present, but continue to issue GCN ranged syncs operations using the original, unpadded size.

Settings.Name: WaDepthStencilTargetMetadataNeedsTccFlush
Settings.Description: Controls whether to F/I TCC when working with depth/stencil targets that use HTile. This is required on Gfx9 by shader reads if the target is MSAA, has stencil, or has metadata in the mip tail region.
